definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: Love dearly this small son of a feudal lord.
I give you, love, is the final release.
sentences.chinese: 我给你，最后的疼爱，是手放开。

sentences.english: He enfolded the child in an affectionate embrace.
sentences.chinese: 他疼爱那孩子而紧紧搂在怀里。

sentences.english: Finally the love is a hand release, later, you are in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 最后的疼爱是手放开，以后，你在我心里。

sentences.english: He cares for his son, Nemo, too much and loves him with all his heart.
sentences.chinese: 他非常疼爱儿子尼莫，全心全意地爱著他。

sentences.english: And let me be Your moon, To mercifully end Your anguished day.
sentences.chinese: 我愿是您明月，疼爱地终止您苦闷的一天。

sentences.english: Thank goodness there are still many humans who love and respect animals.
sentences.chinese: 谢天谢地，现在仍有许多人还疼爱和尊重动物。

sentences.english: I give you last love is let go.
sentences.chinese: 我给你最后的疼爱是手放开。

sentences.english: Parents love newborn, often holding to embrace to fondle admiringly.
sentences.chinese: 父母疼爱新生儿，往往抱来抱去，爱不释手。

sentences.english: He so adores his daughters that he keeps buying them expensive toys.
sentences.chinese: 他非常疼爱女儿，经常给她们买贵重的玩具。

sentences.english: She showed great fondness for her husband, and for his sister, Isabella.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去对丈夫非常疼爱，对他妹妹伊莎贝拉也不错。

sentences.english: Both have strong marriages and beloved children.
sentences.chinese: 他们都忠于婚姻，疼爱孩子。

sentences.english: Among Mr. and Mrs. Huang's six children, they love Lili the most dearly .
sentences.chinese: 在黄先生及他太太的六个孩子当中，他们最疼爱丽丽。

sentences.english: She was short on cash, but always lone on love.
sentences.chinese: 她很缺钱，但出于对我的疼爱她一直保留那笔钱。

sentences.english: Tolerance is love sick with the sickness of haughtiness.
sentences.chinese: 容忍对病泱泱的居傲充满了爱怜与疼爱。

sentences.english: Bernice was very content because she had two little bears, Annabelle and Bruce, who she adored.
sentences.chinese: 柏妮丝很满足，因为她有两只她很疼爱的熊宝宝。

definition: filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
to have tender affection for/to love tenderly/to pamper sb
to take pity on/to feel tenderness toward
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
the utmost care (idiom); to look after sb in every possible way
lit. a pearl in the palm (idiom)/fig. beloved person (esp. daughter)
to cherish/to treasure/to take care of/to love and protect
